In addition to 7 finalists, the Central NM region also brought 2 student observers to the the International Science & Engineering Fair.

Milidu Jayaweera from the Albuquerque Institute of Math & Science and Jacob Sandusky from The ASK Academy earned their spots on the delegation by being the highest placing 8th grade students at the Central NM Science & Engineering Fair.

The ISEF observer program gives students the opportunity to experience ISEF even though they have not qualified as finalists. Milidu and Jacob are able to attend all of the ISEF events, ceremonies, and symposiums as well as participate in programming specifically for student observers. Today, they joined other observers on a tour of the the Carnegie Museum of Natural History. Tomorrow they will volunteer and act as tour guides for local elementary school students who will be visiting ISEF.

Keep up the great work Jacob and Milidu! Hope to see you as ISEF finalists in the future!
